paragraphs.content: Rejoice not, O Israel, for joy, as other people: for thou hast gone a whoring from thy God, thou hast loved a reward upon every cornfloor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Rejoice not, O Israel, for joy, as other people: for thou hast gone a whoring from thy God, thou hast loved a reward upon every cornfloor.

paragraphs.content: The floor and the winepress shall not feed them, and the new wine shall fail in her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The floor and the winepress shall not feed them, and the new wine shall fail in her.

paragraphs.content: They shall not dwell in the LORD’s land; but Ephraim shall return to Egypt, and they shall eat unclean things in Assyria.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They shall not dwell in the Lord’s land; but Ephraim shall return to Egypt, and they shall eat unclean things in Assyria.

paragraphs.content: They shall not offer wine offerings to the LORD, neither shall they be pleasing unto him: their sacrifices shall be unto them as the bread of mourners; all that eat thereof shall be polluted: for their bread for their soul shall not come into the house of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They shall not offer wine offerings to the Lord, neither shall they be pleasing unto him: their sacrifices shall be unto them as the bread of mourners; all that eat thereof shall be polluted: for their bread for their soul shall not come into the house of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: What will ye do in the solemn day, and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What will ye do in the solemn day, and in the day of the feast of the Lord?

paragraphs.content: For, lo, they are gone because of destruction: Egypt shall gather them up, Memphis shall bury them: the pleasant places for their silver, nettles shall possess them: thorns shall be in their tabernacles.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, lo, they are gone because of destruction: Egypt shall gather them up, Memphis shall bury them: the pleasant places for their silver, nettles shall possess them: thorns shall be in their tabernacles.

paragraphs.content: The days of visitation are come, the days of recompence are come; Israel shall know it: the prophet is a fool, the spiritual man is mad, for the multitude of thine iniquity, and the great hatred.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The days of visitation are come, the days of recompence are come; Israel shall know it: the prophet is a fool, the spiritual man is mad, for the multitude of thine iniquity, and the great hatred.

paragraphs.content: The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: but the prophet is a snare of a fowler in all his ways, and hatred in the house of his God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: but the prophet is a snare of a fowler in all his ways, and hatred in the house of his God.

paragraphs.content: They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity, he will visit their sins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity, he will visit their sins.

paragraphs.content: I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness; I saw your fathers as the firstripe in the fig tree at her first time: but they went to Baal-peor, and separated themselves unto that shame; and their abominations were according as they loved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness; I saw your fathers as the firstripe in the fig tree at her first time: but they went to Baal-peor, and separated themselves unto that shame; and their abominations were according as they loved.

paragraphs.content: As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird, from the birth, and from the womb, and from the conception.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird, from the birth, and from the womb, and from the conception.

paragraphs.content: Though they bring up their children, yet will I bereave them, that there shall not be a man left: yea, woe also to them when I depart from them!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though they bring up their children, yet will I bereave them, that there shall not be a man left: yea, woe also to them when I depart from them!

paragraphs.content: Ephraim, as I saw Tyrus, is planted in a pleasant place: but Ephraim shall bring forth his children to the murderer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ephraim, as I saw Tyrus, is planted in a pleasant place: but Ephraim shall bring forth his children to the murderer.

paragraphs.content: Give them, O LORD: what wilt thou give? give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give them, O Lord: what wilt thou give? give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.

paragraphs.content: All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of mine house, I will love them no more: all their princes are revolters.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of mine house, I will love them no more: all their princes are revolters.

paragraphs.content: Ephraim is smitten, their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit: yea, though they bring forth, yet will I slay even the beloved fruit of their womb.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ephraim is smitten, their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit: yea, though they bring forth, yet will I slay even the beloved fruit of their womb.

paragraphs.content: My God will cast them away, because they did not hearken unto him: and they shall be wanderers among the nations.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My God will cast them away, because they did not hearken unto him: and they shall be wanderers among the nations.
